DOC.brief_summary: This study investigate effectiveness manual therapy ( MT ) Electric Nerve Stimulation ( TENS ) reduce pain intensity patient mechanical neck disorder ( MND ) . A randomized multi-centered control clinical trial perform 12 Primary Care Physiotherapy Units Madrid Region .
DOC.brief_title: Manual Therapy Effectiveness Comparison With Electric Nerve Stimulation ( TENS ) Patients With Neck Pain
DOC.detailed_description: The purpose ti study evaluate effectiveness manual therapy ( MT ) Electric Nerve Stimulation ( TENS ) reduce pain intensity patient mechanical neck disorder ( MND ) . Design : randomize multi-centered controlled clinical trial . Location : 12 Primary Care Physiotherapy Units Madrid Region . Ninety patient include diagnosis subacute chronic MND without neurological damage , 47 patient receive MT 43 TENS . The primary outcome pain intensity measure millimeter use Visual Analogue Scale . Also disability , quality life , adverse effect sociodemographic prognosis variable measure . Three evaluation perform ( , procedure finish six month ) . Seventy one patient ( 79 % ) complete follow-up measurement six month . In half treated patient procedure clinically relevant `` short term '' result end intervention , either MT TENS use . The success rate decrease one third patient 6 month intervention . No difference find reduction pain , decrease disability quality life therapy . Both analyzed physiotherapy technique produce short term pain reduction clinically relevant .
DOC.criteria: diagnosis subacute chronic MND without neurological damage , accord Classification Quebec Task Force Spinal Disorders ( Spitzer 1987 ) ; full physical psychological capacity follow clinical trial 's requirement ; consent participate Signs neurological damage accord Neurologic Screening Checklist ( Hoving et al . 2002 ) , pregnant woman , previous neck rachis surgery , patient receive physical therapy alternative treatment neck shoulder 6 month prior begin study , patient intend receive treatment study patient important psychiatric disorder health problem would contraindicate technique use ( i.e . pacemaker ) . Patients neck pain caused inflammatory , neurological rheumatic disease , severe osteoporosis , fracture , luxation vertebrobasilar insufficiency
